data.title: 2d physics: Lots of RigidBodies produce many collisions and won't get to "sleep"
data.body:
Testcase project: 

https://www.dropbox.com/s/9pijuuoo1zzlqgf/test_physics_2d_sleep.zip

Reproduce: 

click "Generate" button several times, observer that when island getting lot's rigibody, it will take forever to turn into sleep state (turn into red color)

data.title: Fix node rename problem
data.body:
If rename node to '.' or '..', will cause problems
1、rename node to '.'
2、rename this node again
3、node's parent name changed
4、remove this node
5、node's parent has removed...

And not recommended use '/' for node name

data.title: Hotkey to delete bezier handle points
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_
- Alt + right click already works to delete normal points in 3D paths
- The hotkey could be extended to also delete bezier handle points in 3D paths, and both normal and bezier handle points in 2D paths

---

I wouldn't call this a bug. Maybe it is more inconsitancy and a small addition.
At the moment you can create new points for your curve by ctrl+click.
With shift you can add bezier handles for each point.

At the moment it is not possible to delete existing handle points or normal points for 2d Pathes . 
In 3D deleting normal points at least works with alt+rightclick.

To make it more consistent it would be great to add the alt+rightclick combination for 2d pathes for normal points and bezier handle points.
And for 3d pathes for bezier handle points.

data.title: Curve2D bake methode not working
data.body:
The Curve 2D bake methode does not work.
It returns an array list with (0,0) coordinates.

Maybe in the same run the followpath can be added for the 2d workflow.

data.title: importing pngs loses indexing
data.body: When importing a png file that uses indexing, or saving it as a resource, the resulting resource file loses the indexing data and the resulting file size is significantly larger.  An alternate solution is to use Godot's compression, WebP, but this produces an inferior image for certain kinds of art - namely cell shading that uses large regions of single colors.

data.title: Scroll speed too fast on macbook
data.body:
Scrolling on mac is way too fast. Scrolling 1cm on the touchpad brings you to the bottom of the page. I haven't tested this with a mouse or on windows so the problem might happen there too.

I am using a macbook air 2012 (mavericks)

data.title: Merge pull request #1 from okamstudio/master
data.body: rebase

data.title: Set project name automatically when choosing path for new projects in project manager
data.body: Very small enhancement, just to get started ;)

data.title: Allow for Editor/Viewport Input Control Profiles with Hotkeys to Change
data.body:
Using Blender 2.7 as an example, it has been released with a FPS style navigation control system to allow in blender game levels to be navigated as if in game - perfect for virtual level previewing & analysis.

Seeing such a feature in Godot would definitely be a bonus but in my mind I can see a much more practical implementation to allow for input control profiles which can be quickly changed on the fly by customizable hot-keys to allow the user to switch between different control methods as they find necessary within the editor/view-port and other elements of Godots GUI interface.

ie. one for geometry editing, a second for general navigation and level previewing
